greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array of the coefficients of the sequence of Abel polynomials A(n,x) := x*(x-n)^(n-1).
comment: The Abel polynomials are associated with the Abel operator t*exp(y*t)*p(x) = t*p(x+y).
Abs(T(n,k)) is the number of rooted labeled trees on n+1 vertices with a root degree k (Clarke's formula).
The row sums in the unsigned case, Sum_{k=0..n} abs(T(n,k)), count the trees on n+1 labeled nodes, A000272(n+1). (End)
Exponential Riordan array [1, W(x)], W(x) the Lambert W-function. - _Paul Barry_, Nov 19 2010
The inverse array is the exponential Riordan array [1, x*exp(x)], which is A059297. - _Peter Bala_, Apr 08 2013
The inverse Bell transform of [1,2,3,...]. See A264428 for the Bell transform and A264429 for the inverse Bell transform. - _Peter Luschny_, Dec 20 2015
Also the Bell transform of (-1)^n*(n+1)^n. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 18 2016
reference: Steve Roman, The Umbral Calculus, Dover Publications, New York (1984), pp. 14 and 29
link: W. Y. Chen, A general bijective algorithm for trees, PNAS December 1, 1990 vol. 87 no. 24 9635-9639.
L. E. Clarke, On Cayley's formula for counting trees, J. London Math. Soc. 33 (1958), 471-475.
Péter L. Erdős and L. A. Székely, Applications of Antilexicographic Order. I., An Enumerative Theory of Trees, Adv. in Appl. Math. 10, (1989) 488-496.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics Abel Polynomial
Bao-Xuan Zhu, Total positivity from a generalized cycle index polynomial, arXiv:2006.14485 [math.CO], 2020.
formula: Row n gives the coefficients of the expansion of x*(x-n)^(n-1).
maple: T := proc(n,k) if n = 0 and k = 0 then 1 else binomial(n-1,k-1)*(-n)^(n-k) fi end; seq(print(seq(T(n,k),k=0..n)),n=0..7); # _Peter Luschny_, Jan 14 2009
# The function BellMatrix is defined in A264428.
mathematica: a0 = 1 a[x, 0] = 1; a[x, 1] = x; a[x_, n_] := x*(x - a0*n)^(n - 1); Table[Expand[a[x, n]], {n, 0, 10}]; a1 = Table[CoefficientList[a[x, n], x], {n, 0, 10}]; Flatten[a1]
BellMatrix[f_, len_] := With[{t = Array[f, len, 0]}, Table[BellY[n, k, t], {n, 0, len - 1}, {k, 0, len - 1}]];
Table[B[[n, k]], {n, 1, rows}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 28 2018, after _Peter Luschny_ *)
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Apr 18 2008
